lead_paragraph: Out of this great war, which is even more a war of ideas than of machines and men, one truth appears: men do not die, or risk death, or make great sacrifices, for things that seem to them far away. In 1938 a British Prime Minister thought Czecho-Slovakia, some six or seven hundred miles distant by air from London, too far off and too little known to be worth a war.
